title: The Forsaken Tower

properties.name: description
properties.value: The Forsaken Tower is a quest in the Great Kourend quest series which focuses on Lovakengj.

content:
This article is about the quest. For the location, see The Forsaken Tower (location).
 This quest has a quick guide found here.
It briefly summarises the steps needed to complete the quest.
The Forsaken Tower (#140)
Released 10 January 2019 (Update)
Members Yes
Quest series Great Kourend
Official difficulty Intermediate
Lead developer(s) Mod Ed

The Forsaken Tower is a quest in the Great Kourend quest series which focuses on Lovakengj.

Contents

  • 1 Details
  • 2 Walkthrough
    • 2.1 The Assembly
    • 2.2 The Quest for the Hammer
      • 2.2.1 The Powerless Grid
      • 2.2.2 The Forsaken Furnace
      • 2.2.3 The Pernicious Potions
      • 2.2.4 The Pylons
    • 2.3 Finishing up
  • 3 Rewards
  • 4 Music
  • 5 Required for completing
  • 6 Transcript
  • 7 Trivia

Details[edit | edit source]

Start point Speak to Lady Vulcana Lovakengj in Lovakengj.
Official difficultyIntermediate
DescriptionFor thousands of years, the Wintertodt has remained safely sealed behind the great Doors of Dinh. Alas, despite the best attempts of the Lovakengj smiths and the Arceuus mages, the doors are failing. Only Dinh himself knew the secrets behind the creation of these doors. Without his knowledge, there may be nothing to stop the Wintertodt escaping and bringing ruin upon Kourend. It is up to you to recover this knowledge.
Official lengthShort
Requirements
  • Completion of the following quests:
    • Client of Kourend
      • X Marks the Spot
  • 20% Lovakengj favour
Items required
  • Tinderbox (obtainable during quest)
Recommended
  • Antipoison
  • Food
  • Games necklace
  • Battlefront teleport
  • Xeric's talisman
  • Stamina potion
  • Dramen Staff or Lunar Staff
  • Bring 6 Coal and 1 Adamantite ore to complete a Hard Kourend & Kebos Diary task (requires 70 Smithing (boostable))
Enemies to defeat None
{"requirements":"*Completion of the following quests:\n**[[Client of Kourend]]\n***[[X Marks the Spot]]\n*20% [[Lovakengj favour]]","desc":"For thousands of years, the Wintertodt has remained safely sealed behind the great Doors of Dinh. Alas, despite the best attempts of the Lovakengj smiths and the Arceuus mages, the doors are failing. Only Dinh himself knew the secrets behind the creation of these doors. Without his knowledge, there may be nothing to stop the Wintertodt escaping and bringing ruin upon Kourend. It is up to you to recover this knowledge.","difficulty":"Intermediate","kills":"None","name":"The Forsaken Tower","start":"Speak to [[Lady Vulcana Lovakengj]] in [[Lovakengj]].","length":"Short","items":"*[[Tinderbox]] (obtainable during quest)"}

Walkthrough[edit | edit source]

The Assembly[edit | edit source]

Items recommended: Games necklace, Xeric's talisman, Battlefront teleport
Unkar tells the player about the Doors of Dinh.

Head to the Lovakengj Assembly, west of the southern bank in Lovakengj of Great Kourend , and talk to Lady Vulcana Lovakengj. A member of the Kourend Council, Councillor Unkar, explains that the blacksmith Undor has found the cause of why the Doors of Dinh are failing, and requests assistance. Agree to help Unkar.

Head to the Wintertodt Camp. A games necklace can be used to get there quickly. If this is your first time here, speak to Ignisia first before continuing. Otherwise, speak to Undor on the west side of the camp. He will explain that the Doors have been purposely damaged by someone or something, creating a small hole in the doors. Although not much, it is enough for the Wintertodt imprisoned within to draw a small amount of power into the prison.

Undor can easily fix the damage done, but he needs an ancient hammer in order to repair the doors, which he believes is located in The Forsaken Tower, located on the peninsula due west of Lovakengj and due east[?] of Mount Karuulm.

Fairy ring cir takes you to the base of Mount Karuulm. Alternatively, players can use their Battlefront teleport to get to the graveyard directly south of the Forsaken Tower.

Tip: Players with 70 Smithing planning to complete a hard task for the Kourend & Kebos Diary should also bring an adamantite ore and six coal. Warning: Be sure to follow the steps below before igniting the furnace; otherwise, you may take up to 34 damage.

The Quest for the Hammer[edit | edit source]

Undor requests help from the player.
The location of the Forsaken Tower.

Once you're inside the tower, inspect the display case. The interface shown displays each of the four puzzles required to unlock the case.

Optionally, search the crate by the south-west corner to obtain an ancient letter, which gives you a little more insight into the Tower's history.

The Powerless Grid[edit | edit source]

  • The display case interface.

  • The powergrid solution.

Go into the basement and search the crates in the room immediately east of the ladder until you find a generator crank. Start the steam generator using the crank. Once the generator is started, align the power grid in the centre of the room (solution above).

The Forsaken Furnace[edit | edit source]

Items needed: Tinderbox

Go in one of the doors at the back of the tower. In the northern room, search the cupboards for a tinderbox, and a 5 and 8-gallon jug.
Warning: Do not light the furnace before completing the next step or you will take over 20 hitpoints of damage.
In the north-west corner of the room there is a coolant dispenser. The objective is to get 4 gallons in the 5 gallon jug, which can be done by following these steps:

Adding coolant to the coolant mechanism.
  • Fill the 5-gallon jug with coolant making 5-0
  • Use the 5-gallon jug on the empty 8 gallon jug making 0-5
  • Fill the 5-gallon jug with coolant making 5-5
  • Use the 5-gallon jug on the 8 gallon jug making 2-8
  • Empty the 8 gallon jug (select "check" then "continue") making 2-0
  • Use the 5-gallon jug on the empty 8 gallon jug again making 0-2
  • Fill the 5-gallon jug with coolant making 5-2
  • Use the 5-gallon jug on the 8 gallon jug again making 0-7
  • Fill the 5-gallon jug with coolant making 5-7
  • Use the 5-gallon jug on the 8 gallon jug again making 4-8

The riddle is a math problem known as a Water pouring puzzle, in which you must determine a multiple of 8s and 5s between which the difference is 4. Therefore, the solution is either to fill up the 5-gallon jug 4 times (+20) and emptying the 8-gallon twice (-16), or filling up the 8-gallon jug 3 times (+24) and emptying the 5-gallon jug 4 times (-20).

You should now have 4 gallons in the 5 gallon jug. Use the 5-gallon jug (with 4 gallons in it) on the furnace coolant mechanism on the left side of the furnace. Once it's full, light the furnace using your tinderbox.

Note: Once the furnace has been lit, players can smelt an adamantite bar for a Kourend & Kebos Diary hard task.

The Pernicious Potions[edit | edit source]

Items recommended: Antipoison and Food.

Go upstairs to the 1st floor[UK]2nd floor[US]. You will see a table of potions and a refinery. The refinery needs to be activated, but before it can be, it needs to be cleansed, by use of cleansing fluid. One of the potions on the table is cleansing fluid, but the correct number is random for each player. Using the wrong fluid on the refinery will result in up to 40 damage and poisoning. With an antipoison and plenty of food, the puzzle can be brute-forced by trial and error.

A visual explanation of the solution.

To solve which potion is the correct one, you can search the cupboard in the south-east[?] corner of the room to find old notes with a riddle, which includes some potions' locations on the table relative to each other. The potion you need to get is the cleansing fluid. The riddle layout is the same for everyone, but the fluids differ.

  • Fluid A is directly left of Fluid B.
  • Fluid B is next to Fluid C.
  • Fluid D is directly right of Fluid E.
  • Fluid A is opposite Fluid D.

For the solution:

  • A has to be 1 (far left).
  • B has to be 2 (middle left).
  • C has to be 3 (middle).
  • D has to be 5 (far right).
  • E has to be 4 (middle right).

Once you've chosen the correct fluid, click on the refinery, cleanse it, and then activate it.

The Pylons[edit | edit source]

The altar at the top of the tower.

Go up the ladder to the 2nd floor[UK]3rd floor[US]. You will be in a room with three energy pylons and a runic altar. The western pylon has four weighted energy disks on it of varying size. The objective of this puzzle is to stack all of the rings in order on the middle pylon.

Remove the disc from a pylon and place it on another pylon in the following order:

  • From West (W) to East (E)
  • From W to Centre (C)
  • From E to C
  • From W to E
  • From C to W
  • From C to E
  • From W to E
  • From W to C
  • From E to C
  • From E to W
  • From C to W
  • From E to C
  • From W to E
  • From W to C
  • From E to C

With this done, all of the locks on the display case should be green. Go downstairs to the ground floor[UK]1st floor[US] and retrieve Dinh's hammer.

Finishing up[edit | edit source]

Return to Undor at the Wintertodt Camp, and give him Dinh's hammer. Now, he can fix the Doors of Dinh, but even so, the pyromancers will have to continue subduing the Wintertodt, as it has already gained much power in the time the Doors were damaged. He will tell you to return to Lady Vulcana Lovakengj. Speak to her to complete the quest and obtain your reward.

Congratulations, Quest Complete!

Rewards[edit | edit source]

  • 1 Quest point
  • 500 Mining experience
  • 500 Smithing experience
  • 6,000 coins
  • Lovakengj favour certificate. Reading it grants 10% Lovakengj favour.
  • A page for Kharedst's memoirs, 'Jewellery of jubilation.' It teleports players north-east of the bank in Lovakengj.

Music[edit | edit source]

  • The Forsaken Tower

Required for completing[edit | edit source]

Completion of The Forsaken Tower is required for the following:

  • A Kingdom Divided

Transcript[edit | edit source]

This article on a quest has an associated dialogue page.
Click here for a transcript of possible conversations encountered throughout the quest.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • The pylons are a Tower of Hanoi puzzle, a classic puzzle invented in 1883.
  • The coolant puzzle is likely a reference to the 4-gallon jug puzzle in the film Die Hard 3.

It is up to you to recover this knowledge. |length = Short |requirements = *Completion of the following quests: **[[Client of Kourend]] ***[[X Marks the Spot]] *20% [[Lovakengj favour]] |items = *[[Tinderbox]] (obtainable during quest) |recommended= *[[Antipoison]] *[[Food]] *[[Games necklace]] *[[Battlefront teleport]] *[[Xeric's talisman]] *[[Stamina potion]] *[[Dramen Staff]] or [[Lunar Staff]] *Bring 6 [[Coal]] and 1 [[Adamantite ore]] to complete a [[Hard Kourend & Kebos Diary]] task (requires {{SCP|Smithing|70|link=yes}} {{Boostable|yes}}) |kills = None }} ==Walkthrough== ===The Assembly=== {{Needed|recommended=[[Games necklace]], [[Xeric's talisman]], [[Battlefront teleport]]}} [[File:The Forsaken Tower - Unkar explains.png|thumb|right|Unkar tells the player about the Doors of Dinh.]] [[File:Lady Vulcana Lovakengj chathead.png|left]] Head to the [[Lovakengj Assembly]], west of the southern bank in [[Lovakengj]] of [[Great Kourend]] , and talk to [[Lady Vulcana Lovakengj]]. A member of the [[Kourend Council]], [[Councillor Unkar]], explains that the blacksmith [[Undor]] has found the cause of why the [[Doors of Dinh]] are failing, and requests assistance. Agree to help Unkar. Head to the [[Wintertodt Camp]]. A [[games necklace]] can be used to get there quickly. If this is your first time here, speak to [[Ignisia]] first before continuing. Otherwise, speak to [[Undor]] on the west side of the camp. He will explain that the Doors have been purposely damaged by someone or something, creating a small hole in the doors. Although not much, it is enough for the [[Wintertodt]] imprisoned within to draw a small amount of power into the prison. Undor can easily fix the damage done, but he needs an ancient hammer in order to repair the doors, which he believes is located in [[The Forsaken Tower (location)|The Forsaken Tower]], located on the peninsula due west of Lovakengj and due east{{Direction}} of [[Mount Karuulm]]. Fairy ring {{Fairycode|cir}} takes you to the base of Mount Karuulm. Alternatively, players can use their [[Battlefront teleport]] to get to the graveyard directly south of the Forsaken Tower. '''Tip:''' Players with 70 [[Smithing]] planning to complete a [[Kourend & Kebos Diary#Hard|hard task]] for the [[Kourend & Kebos Diary]] should also bring an [[adamantite ore]] and six [[coal]]. '''{{Colour|red|Warning}}:''' Be sure to follow the steps below before igniting the furnace; otherwise, you may take up to 34 damage. ===The Quest for the Hammer=== [[File:The Forsaken Tower - Undor needs a hammer.png|thumb|right|Undor requests help from the player.]] {{Map|name=The Forsaken Tower|x:1383,y:3813|plane=0|mapID=0|align=right|height=250|width=250|caption=The location of the Forsaken Tower.}} Once you're inside the tower, inspect the [[Display Case (The Forsaken Tower)|display case]]. The interface shown displays each of the four puzzles required to unlock the case. Optionally, search the crate by the south-west corner to obtain an [[ancient letter]], which gives you a little more insight into the Tower's history. ====The Powerless Grid==== File:The Forsaken Tower - Display case interface.png|The display case interface. File:The Forsaken Tower - Powergrid solution.png|The powergrid solution. Go into the basement and search the crates in the room immediately east of the ladder until you find a [[generator crank]]. Start the [[steam generator]] using the crank. Once the generator is started, align the [[power grid]] in the centre of the room (solution above). ====The Forsaken Furnace==== {{Needed|[[Tinderbox]]}} Go in one of the doors at the back of the tower. In the northern room, search the cupboards for a [[tinderbox]], and a [[5-gallon jug|5]] and [[8-gallon jug]].
'''{{Colour|red|Warning}}:''' Do not light [[Furnace (The Forsaken Tower)|the furnace]] before completing the next step or you will take over 20 hitpoints of damage.
In the north-west corner of the room there is a [[coolant dispenser]]. The objective is to get 4 gallons in the 5 gallon jug, which can be done by following these steps: [[File:The Forsaken Tower - Adding coolant.png|thumb|right|Adding coolant to the coolant mechanism.]] {{Checklist| *Fill the 5-gallon jug with coolant making 5-0 *Use the 5-gallon jug on the empty 8 gallon jug making 0-5 *Fill the 5-gallon jug with coolant making 5-5 *Use the 5-gallon jug on the 8 gallon jug making 2-8 *Empty the 8 gallon jug (select "check" then "continue") making 2-0 *Use the 5-gallon jug on the empty 8 gallon jug again making 0-2 *Fill the 5-gallon jug with coolant making 5-2 *Use the 5-gallon jug on the 8 gallon jug again making 0-7 *Fill the 5-gallon jug with coolant making 5-7 *Use the 5-gallon jug on the 8 gallon jug again making 4-8 }} The riddle is a math problem known as a {{WP|Water pouring puzzle}}, in which you must determine a multiple of 8s and 5s between which the difference is 4. Therefore, the solution is either to fill up the 5-gallon jug 4 times (+20) and emptying the 8-gallon twice (-16), or filling up the 8-gallon jug 3 times (+24) and emptying the 5-gallon jug 4 times (-20). You should now have 4 gallons in the 5 gallon jug. Use the 5-gallon jug (with 4 gallons in it) on the [[furnace coolant]] mechanism on the left side of the furnace. Once it's full, light the furnace using your tinderbox. '''Note:''' Once the furnace has been lit, players can smelt an [[adamantite bar]] for a [[Kourend & Kebos Diary]] [[Kourend & Kebos Diary#Hard|hard task]]. ====The Pernicious Potions==== {{Needed|recommended=[[Antipoison]] and [[Food]].}} Go upstairs to the {{FloorNumber|uk=1}}. You will see a [[Table (The Forsaken Tower)|table of potions]] and a [[refinery]]. The refinery needs to be activated, but before it can be, it needs to be cleansed, by use of cleansing fluid. One of the [[unknown fluid|potions]] on the table is cleansing fluid, but the correct number is random for each player. Using the wrong fluid on the refinery will result in up to 40 damage and poisoning. With an antipoison and plenty of food, the puzzle can be brute-forced by trial and error. [[File:The Forsaken Tower - old notes explanation.png|thumb|300px|A visual explanation of the solution.]] To solve which potion is the correct one, you can search the cupboard in the south-east{{Direction}} corner of the room to find [[old notes (The Forsaken Tower)|old notes]] with a riddle, which includes some potions' locations on the table relative to each other. The potion you need to get is the '''cleansing fluid'''. The riddle layout is the same for everyone, but the fluids differ. *Fluid A is directly left of Fluid B. *Fluid B is next to Fluid C. *Fluid D is directly right of Fluid E. *Fluid A is opposite Fluid D. For the solution: *A has to be 1 (far left). *B has to be 2 (middle left). *C has to be 3 (middle). *D has to be 5 (far right). *E has to be 4 (middle right). Once you've chosen the correct fluid, click on the refinery, cleanse it, and then activate it. ====The Pylons==== [[File:The Forsaken Tower - The altar.png|thumb|right|The altar at the top of the tower.]] Go up the ladder to the {{FloorNumber|uk=2}}. You will be in a room with three [[energy pylon]]s and a [[Runic Altar (The Forsaken Tower)|runic altar]]. The western pylon has four weighted [[energy disk]]s on it of varying size. The objective of this puzzle is to stack all of the rings in order on the middle pylon. Remove the disc from a pylon and place it on another pylon in the following order: {{Checklist| *From West '''(W)''' to East '''(E)''' *From '''W''' to Centre '''(C)''' *From '''E''' to '''C''' *From '''W''' to '''E''' *From '''C''' to '''W''' *From '''C''' to '''E''' *From '''W''' to '''E''' *From '''W''' to '''C''' *From '''E''' to '''C''' *From '''E''' to '''W''' *From '''C''' to '''W''' *From '''E''' to '''C''' *From '''W''' to '''E''' *From '''W''' to '''C''' *From '''E''' to '''C''' }} With this done, all of the locks on the display case should be green. Go downstairs to the {{FloorNumber|uk=0}} and retrieve [[Dinh's hammer]]. ===Finishing up=== Return to [[Undor]] at the [[Wintertodt Camp]], and give him [[Dinh's hammer]]. Now, he can fix the [[Doors of Dinh]], but even so, the [[pyromancer]]s will have to continue subduing the [[Wintertodt]], as it has already gained much power in the time the Doors were damaged. He will tell you to return to [[Lady Vulcana Lovakengj]]. Speak to her to complete the quest and obtain your reward.
